articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli jets and artillery hit multiple targets in southern Lebanon overnight, Israel's military said on Thursday, amid spiralling tensions following the mass attack on Hezbollah communications devices this week.
articles.title: Israeli strikes hit multiple targets in Lebanon

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Thursday that Ukrainian forces had reduced the potential of Russian troops to launch attacks in Donetsk region on the eastern front of the more than 2 1/2-year-old war.
articles.title: Zelenskiy says Ukrainian military has reduced Russian potential to attack on eastern front

articles.author: Michelle Nichols, Maya Gebeily
articles.description: A preliminary investigation by Lebanese authorities into the communications devices that blew up in Lebanon this week found that they were implanted with explosives before arriving in the country, according to a letter sent to the U.N. Security Council by Lebanon's mission to the United Nations.
articles.title: Explosives put in devices before they arrived in Lebanon, says Lebanon's UN mission

articles.author: Anastasiia Malenko
articles.description: U.N. monitoring body criticised Russia over its repeated strikes on the energy grid.
articles.title: Russia attacks Ukraine geriatric centre and power grid

articles.author: Barbara Erling
articles.description: The army said 16,000 soldiers were helping out in the region, alongside police and thousands of volunteers.
articles.title: Poland's third-largest city braces for peaking floods

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Six Palestinians were killed and 18 others injured by Israeli forces during a military raid in the occupied West Bank city of Qabatiya, the governor of Jenin told Reuters on Thursday.
articles.title: Six Palestinians killed by Israeli forces in occupied West Bank's Qabatiya

articles.author: Daphne Psaledakis, Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: The United States on Thursday warned all parties in the Middle East against escalation as tensions between Iran-backed Lebanese movement Hezbollah and Israel remained high, saying Washington's priority is to find a diplomatic solution.
articles.title: U.S. warns all parties against escalation in the Middle East

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A senior Russian lawmaker on Thursday said that Ukrainian strikes on Russia with Western missiles would lead to global war with the use of nuclear weapons and that Moscow's response would be tough with more powerful weapons.
articles.title: Top Russian lawmaker warns West of nuclear war over Ukraine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An elaborate attack by an Al Qaeda affiliate in Mali's capital this week killed some 70 people, diplomatic and security sources said on Thursday, while the government offered no figures on casualties.
articles.title: Dozens killed in Mali attack by Al Qaeda affiliate

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov vowed in an interview published on Friday that Moscow would defend its interests in the Arctic both in diplomatic and military terms.
articles.title: Lavrov vows Russia to defend its Arctic interests
